intro: Psathura terniflora, commonly known as the three-leafed psathura, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitats.
